Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: swyantk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, the room was clean and the service was friendly. The pool was cleaned twice a day whether anyone used it or not! If you are working or exploring Ponce this is a great place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: yduranri
Reviews.Content: Hi! This hotel is amazing! I arrived at 3pm and my room wasn't already clean, so they give one with direct access to the pool it was the best offer for the kids it was great, the pool had a great ocean view. There are many options for dinner and places to go, like Plaza del Caribe Mall, Art Museum, Ponce Downtown and other places. The room always was clean, the staff was very kind, they have Priority Club member and you can earn points and receive many benefits. The restaurant is great with razonable prices. I loved my vacations with my husband and kids..next year we come again!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you must got to Ponce...”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: While we found the city to be a "dud"...it was dead after 5:00 p.m., the Holiday Inn Ponce is an okay place to stay. The hotel is located just west of the city on a hill overlooking a lagoon and in the distance, the Caribbean. The rooms are standard holiday inn, nothing more and nothing less. The pool was quite large, though the water was cool. Of course, no one else was at the pool. There is also a jacuzzi like pool that is not a jacuzzi and equally cold. The people at the front desk were friendly, though their directions were outdated as the road they suggested was closed after a couple of miles. The casino seems to be the main attraction and there were tons of locals playing...An okay hotel in a somewhat boring area...unlike most of Puerto Rico which we truly enjoyed...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ergoe
Reviews.Content: It's a small place as casino resorts go. In this case, small isn't necessarily beautiful. The hotel is located on top of a small hill with a good view of the ocean. The room was typical Holiday Inn: adequate. The same can be said about the food. While I am fine with a room that is adequate, my expectations in the food department are a little higher. However, I did like their black bean soup. I had it twice. The breakfast that came with the free breakfast coupon was very adequate. Service was good, friendly and unpretentious. Just helpful. At the reception desk, in the bar and in the dining room. The wireless internet is free. And you get what you don't pay for. Forget about watching a news video clip in total before you fall asleep. Not good. Apparently, this hotel has not made it into the list of addresses accessible to GPS. We drove here from San Juan. My GPS unit did not recognize it, so I entered just any old address in Ponce, hoping that I would have better luck once I got here. Of course I didn't. So I had a heck of a time finding my way to it out of the labyrinth of streets without signs that is Ponce. I have no idea how anyone finds an address here. We ended up asking a couple of policemen for directions. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with many amenities”
Reviews.Author: metalmomma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a cruise and extended stay in Puerto Rico where we visited the city of Ponce. The Holiday Inn & Casino in Ponce is located on a hill overlooking the ocean and near the main highway. The rooms are typical for a Holiday Inn, although all have a little balcony outside a sliding glass door, rather than just a window. Unfortunately, our room was at ground level, so the balcony really wasn't an advantage. Rooms located on the upper floors have nicer views and allow one to leave their doors open to take advantage of the ocean breeze. The beds and pillows were very comfortable and there is a large flat screen TV with lots of channels to choose from. The bathroom was modern and a good size. Not much hanging space, but there is a little refrigerator and good drawer space. The hotel has a fairly large casino, restaurant and large bar. We were given a complimentary drink and a $10 matching bet, although we did not gamble. The pool is very large and has lots of patio area and seating around it, plus there is also more patio and seating area above the pool. The hotel is very clean and it and the grounds are well maintained. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful and genuinely warm and welcoming. The hotel is close to several restaurants located right on the beach, so you can enjoy the sunset over the ocean with your meal.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: patthecma
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was about what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. There is a lot of local traffic due to the casino. The room was clean and neat. Evidently, there was no complimentary continental breakfast, and it was a bit pricey for the fare. The hamburgers are a better bargain if you decide to eat dinner there. All in all, its a nice Holiday Inn style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: bills_pix
Reviews.Content: Wish we had spent more time in Ponce to explore the area. Hotel is conveniently located but being in downtown Ponce might have been more fun. Front desk staff was helpful in suggesting a sunset spot. Room was clean and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I expected from Holiday Inn. That's not a bad thing.”
Reviews.Author: Sandsculptureman
Reviews.Content: We checked in Saturday afternoon. The desk clerk was very helpfull. She made us feel like we're valued guests. Several times throughout our stay she helped us with restaurant suggestions as well as things to do in the area. She was happy to take all the time we needed, not once making us feel rushed. We booked a junior suite. The room was spacious. There is a microwave, mini fridge, table with two chairs, and a nice desk with office chair. The room is a bit dated but it was clean. There was a slight musty odor. My wife is an infection control fanatic. After checking the mattress seams for bed bugs, it recieved her approval. We has a room on the 4th floor, right near the elevator. The noise was not as bad as mentioned in an earlier review. The pool is large and looked clean but it too was dated. The casino looked like the reason the hotel exists. I think it is the primary reason most people come here. It is certainly not Vegas, but much larger than others in the San Juan area. I do think it would be nice if they reserved some of the closer parking spaces for hotel guests. They seem to fill up fast with casino patrons.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT TRIP!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: VIVMAUDLIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a 3 day weekend at the hotel and had a wonderful time. The desk staff (Rosa) and (Jenai) were so very helpful getting us cabs and suggesting great local places to eat. The hotel is high on a bluff and you see the ocean ..The breezes are warm and inviting. The hotel lobby, restaurant and rooms were very clean and the staff very attentive. The pool area is very large and you never feel crowded. It is quiet and very restful. Beautiful views and breezes! There is a shade area by the pool and it is surrounded by swaying palms.....AMAZING local restaurants nearby ( ask the hotel to call a cab for you (usually 15.00 to your destination) nothing like having a great dinner overlooking the ocean...again a restful experience. We took a cab into the town square of Ponce and walked around (sidewalks rolled up at 6pm!) and your cab driver gave us his personal cell so you can call them back to get you after you are finished.....but really the best part was the outstanding ( and VERY reasonable) roomservice breakfast brought to you on a rolling table and a second cup of coffee on your private balcony overlooking the ocean.... and then a day lounging by the pool......There is a casino , music, and a bar in the hotel. The Ponce airport is a short cabride away ($30.00) No hotel shuttle. Overall a great stay at a clean, well managed hotel. Book a room overlooking the pool on the 4th floor for the best views. A++ WE WILL BE BACK!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite property in the Ponce area”
Reviews.Author: yazoo_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit the Ponce area regularly and always stay at this hotel, even though there are plenty of other options in the area with which we are familiar. Our most recent stay was a four-day holiday weekend. It sits on a hill overlooking the Caribbean Sea, a campus-style property with a particularly pretty and ample pool area. Although the hotel's location is convenient for exploring area attractions, a car or some other ground-transportation arrangement is an absolute must for travelers staying at this hotel, which is also true for Puerto Rico as a whole, a car-dependent island. The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and nicely furnished. The front-desk, maintenance and food/beverage staffs are excellent. Rates are on the pricey end for Holiday Inns at large, but one definitely gets what one pays for. The on-site restaurant serves very good food. We will most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Twin to the Mayaguez Property”
Reviews.Author: roycharles
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in the Mayaguez Holiday Inn on a previous evening and liked it, so we selected this property for the next night. We were told in Mayaguez that the hotels were owned by the same owner. This property is in many ways a twin to the Mayaguez......same carpeting in the hallways.....same furniture and similar menus in the restaurant. I think I prefer the Mayaguez property for the following reason: The hotel, although attached to the Casino, seems more separated in Mayaguez than in Ponce.....the lobby in Mayaguez is somewhat isolated from the Casino, so the entrance is more pleasant. In Ponce a lot of the Casino traffic is moving in the lobby and creates a bit more of a chaotic feel to it.....no big deal....but not pleasing to this traveler. The guest rooms in both hotels are nicely appointed and maintained. The restaurant in Mayaguez is more professionally served than in Ponce. The food is each is fine. These Holiday Inn properties are really better than the average of those that will be generally be found in the mainland of the US. One comment on the Ponce property......the flushing of the toilets makes one a little nervous......the water pressure seems a little low.....when flushing the water rises to the top of the bowl before finally and slowing receding.....sometimes requires more than one flush to complete the job.....makes you wonder if the thing is going to overflow.....but it did not. Sorry to be so graphic......but generally these kinds of toilet facilities make one a bit uneasy. Really.....this is a well run hotel and is worth a stay. Don't know about the Casino......generally I don't care for Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints what so ever with this hotel. I was actually impressed with this being a Holiday Inn. I stayed here two nights in late December. The room was clean, flat screen tv, with enough English channels, bathroom was nice. I stayed a Sheraton later in my trip in Old San Juan and would say that this hotel was definitely on par with the Sheraton. The hotel was at the top of a hill, but made for a great view. Our room had a tree blocking our view but most rooms I would imagine would have great views. The pool area was huge. My girlfriend and I laid out with fantastic weather one day, not one other person on the pool which was fine by us. Nothing is in walking distance, so best to have a rental car or you will have to cab it. The casino was no Vegas, but had the basics. Wish it had an active poker table, but I read that Holdâ€™em isnâ€™t very big in Puerto Rico, so it wasnâ€™t a big deal. My only complaint was the drink service was very limited, donâ€™t expect to get many drinks, but if you are playing table games and spending a little money I think they are free, least the couple I had were. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Great Value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: coqui69
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a very nice spot. Must of the recognize fast foods are close to the hotel and also lots of local restaurants. We had a very nice room wt an ocean view. Pool area is ok,food at the restaurant good and not expensive. Staff not so friendly,needs to improve customer service. Overall we give the hotel a 7 from a 10

Reviews.Title: “The hotel stay was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: LouBoston89
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and staff very professional. The hotel near everything by car. My family and I are already planning our next PR vacation in Ponce. Also, you can't beat having a casino onsite at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TurbineSurgeon
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the afternoon and was not allowed to check in until after 4pm. The most convenient elevator was out of service for the majority of my stay. The rooms were comfortable, and the beds were nice. I thought the restaurant pricing structure was odd. They allowed an entire boys' basketball team stay on the executive level, which was not conducive to getting restful sleep during the day. I received a random door knock and phone call from the coach trying to rouse his players. Next time I am in the area, I am going to try the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “No beach access, no early check in”
Reviews.Author: NoneNoneNone25234525
Reviews.Content: does not have beach access and is not very friendly. When we attempted to check in at 7am the receptionist said that that the rooms were ready but requested extra $100 for early check in. We chose to wait until the regular check in time.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in the area, but dont count on good sleep”
Reviews.Author: butlerfamilyzoo
Reviews.Content: This was a rather long stay at this hotel (2 months work/vacation related). Staff are very friendly and helpful and the restaurant is very good. The beds however are VERY firm, and the pillows get a bit hard quickly. The pool area is very clean and the view is excellent. However, the casino is pretty big with the locals and dont be surprised to see the lobby full of kids while their parents are gambling. The parking lot can get VERY full due to the casino and you may be stuck parking way at the back, dont let this discourage you too much, the closer to the hotel you park, the more you risk your vehicle getting hit. Ours has. Dont expect the police to show up quickly for your report, this took 3hrs of waiting on them. Not exactly as comfortable as i expect a holiday inn, but otherwise ok.

Reviews.Title: “Its ok. clean... but expensive..”
Reviews.Author: airplntech
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend. I wasnt allowed to check in early at all.After a long ride from san juan i had to wait in the pool area for 3: 00 pm. .. Room was clean. updated and nice.Very quiet at night so i got a good sleep..Didnt use their restaurant. The pool area is well kept. The only problem with these hotels is that they are very expensive. Its not worth $140 a night.. no way .. cheaper to stay in Miami or New York.. I went beause i went for a wedding otherwise this is not a place for leisure.. The city looks horrible except for some highlights like the old firehouse and a few things around.. I recommend that if you are unfamiliar with the area dont drive there at night.. looks dangerous.. Good luck!!!!1

Reviews.Title: “A Big improvement from last year”
Reviews.Author: ColinRAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel again this week and this is my second review. I didn't have the greatest of expectations when I checked in but I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were much more friendlily than last time I stayed. Also, that dreadful smell in the hallways has now gone. The restaurant has changed it's menu and the food now is allot better than before. The furniture in the rooms has been upgraded, new TV's and quieter air conduction units have been installed. A much better stay than last time, someone in management is doing their job. On the down side, they do offer internet access throughout the hotel via WiFi. It's basically a dialup internet connected to a WiFi router. Very slow, and if more than two guests are trying to use it then it just stops. Not the place if you want to get on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret in the South of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: RickCAAM
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 3 young children; 10,11 and 13 year-old. The place is located on top of a hill, away from trafic and with an outstanding view of the Caribbean. It has a nice pool with plenty of shallow area for young children to play and a deeper 10-ft deep area for the more mature. The place has a nice casino a full size work-out area and is away from the heavy traffic of Ponce. A place called "La Guancha" is not far away (a boardwalk with local food...). There's also a full size shopping center 5 minutes away. Back to the hotel...the service was up to our US Holiday Inn standards in terms of the the size and cleanliness of the room, amount of towels, cable and w-fi. Breakfast was not included though. People were very kind, bilingual and we did not have to hussle over pricing or hidden charges. One last thing, their address was not in the GPS...so we had to call 'em up.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from here”
Reviews.Author: principe59
Reviews.Content: I stay 1 day, for $147 , so dirty carpets in the hallways and inside the room # 229. For that price stay at the Ponce Hilton You will glad to paid even xtra few $. And yes the Hskp Manager should start a full clean in those carpets they are dirty dirty. The carpet in our room felt dirty when u walked on it. So we tried to wear footwear most of the time. Like the other person said is true. They only care about the people in the casino. Not friendly at all. I was with my 2 years old. And there is not central air, so you have that big air conditioner inside your room very noise. PLEASE KEEP AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. EXPENSIVE AND CHEAP.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: omt4Jesus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 10 days and 9 nights. WOW what a veiw and the staff was so kind and helpful. The pool was clean and the water temperture was perfect and the breakfast was just awesome! There staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. I could not believe how close everything was: Walmart, Walgreens, Subway, McDonalds, K-Mart, Sams Club and many more just 5 minutes. Family own bakery 2 minutes away and more...

Reviews.Title: “Got what I expected, what i paid for”
Reviews.Author: gldUsa
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at the Holiday Inn in Ponce. Prior to departure I read all of the reviews on this site from other folks. Some of it is very valid, but some of the other comments are not. The Hotel was pretty much what I'm used to seeing at a Holiday Inn. The rooms were nice and the bedding and linens were pretty comfortable. One thing that i found odd was that all of the rooms were smoking rooms. However, the rooms didn't have that smoke scent to them. Being a non-smoker I'm very sensitive to it, but I couldn't smell it at all. Many people commented on the food at the restaurant in other reviews. I ate dinner there two nights and couldn't say a negative thing about the food. Even the breakfast buffet was pretty good for $10.00. Sure, it's not the waffle house but I've had much worse. There are only two things I can say negative about my stay: 1. was that I paid $7 a glass for the house wine. Unlike Vegas, your not getting the free drinks while you gamble at the casino and at that rate I spent more on the booze than the tables. 2. Don't plan on working on your guns while you're there. The fitness center was two bikes, a stair stepper and 1 treadmill. If your fitness diet requires any daily allowance of Iron you're SOL.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment, the facilities, management and the bill”
Reviews.Author: AlexisTX
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms for one night and four people in total, (2/2) I was overcharged with $ 25.00 additional for each person including my self. I contacted the management and they said that was a "mistake on the online reservation" right,!!. they agreed to refund the difference, never happen. Now I have too dispute thought the credit card. (by the way I paid extra for rooms with ocean view, the room were with partial view of the pool.) The rooms were clean but dated, they a/c did not worked properly. The facilities are ok, the only good thing is the free parking.

Reviews.Title: “OK but a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Scousepeasant
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here and paid $150 including taxes and breakfast. The staff was friendly and the pool area was nice. We were given a room at the opposite end of the hotel from the casino which meant it was mostly quiet, but twice (once at 6pm and once at about 6 am) somebody opened a fire door and we had to wait ages for somebody to come and turn off the alarm which was very noisy. The room was OK but the place didn't have much character and for the money we stayed at much nicer places in Puerto Rico. For 1 night it's fine but it's not great. The free wifi was appreciated though.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: doudou97
Reviews.Content: Quick check inn, nice staff, nice room (we would of appreciated a microwave in the room, we hat to go to the restaurant to heat the food for the baby, but it was not a problem, the girls at the restaurant were very friendly), the pool is great . The only thing we did not like was the food from the restaurant, it was just horrible. We tried the restaurant on the first night and it was awfull (we didn't eat anything), we gave it a second chance coming back from a long day visiting, we had sandwiches from the room service, it was terrible. How can someone make a chicken and a club sandwich so revolting, I don't know but don't eat in the restaurant !

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: First2PR
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about the hotel was that the staff was friendly. Everything else was terrible. The rooms and bathrooms were disgusting. The rooms smelled like mold and the AC unit sounded like a truck was in the room with you. It was a family vacation and we had 4 rooms and children and teens. There was no access to the beach and there was major construction on the road and on the highway along the hotel. The casino which we thought would be fun was always packed with locals. Which is fine if the casino was away from the rooms, but you had to fight your way through the lobby to get to the elevator to your rooms. And the floors were accessible to everyone. The casino and club clients always had the parking lot packed. You had to walk to the end of the earth to get parking, and that really stinks after a day of traveling and touring the island. Do not stay here, the only rooms with a view are the ones facing the pool. You can find better hotels and if you have a choice stay in San Juan. We spent a day there and it is beautiful and you will pay the same price or even less for a nicer hotel on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “An Average stay....”
Reviews.Author: Jinx*Ya
Reviews.Content: The location is nice on a hill top that was nice. The rooms were average there was mole on the walls and around bathtub but didn't really care I wasn't gonna be living in my room for vacation. One night found moled on 4 out of 8 pillows (had 2 double beds) called and within 2 minutes I had fresh new 4 pillows. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the pool it was a nice view of the pool and the sea. Staff ok food ok casino didn't go in but on the weekend the locals come to this casino and parking is tough. Would I stay here again probably not. There is a water park literally 2 minutes away by car...was fun one day with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: sanjuantraveller
Reviews.Content: We were on our way to Rincon and decided to spend one night in Ponce to enjoy some of the attractions of Ponce, but also to experience Pito's at night. The Holiday Inn was up on a hill and had every ammenity you could think of. The rooms were very, very clean and newly renovated. The bed was comfortable and the room was quite large and had a fridge, micro-wave, marble bathroom. I was very impressed and would advise anyone to stay here. The price was right and also continental breakfast was included in our rate. Parking was free and it had a casino as well. Don't pass this one up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views from Holiday Inn Ponce!”
Reviews.Author: Berks1970
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this review by stating we're Platinum Priorty Club Members, but I think this would have been a good choice regardless. Check-in was flawless. The bilingual staff was very helpful and accomodating. Free breakfast and drink coupons were provided on account of our Priority Club status. Our room was nothing fancy, but it overlooked the Caribbean. Couldn't ask for more than that! Watched a picture-perfect sunset from our balcony. The double beds were a little small for us, and just ok from a comfort standpoint. The bathroom functioned as it should, and the amenities were standard Holiday Inn issue. The towels were not so great. Like drying off with sandpaper. These could use improvement! We took advantage of the very neat and clean pool area. The water was cool, but extremely clean and otherwise pleasant. There were not many people around, so you could really relax. It's probably not always like that, but on our two days here, it was. One complaint - the lounge chairs were a little stained, like yours probably get at home. I think it's probably time to replace some of them. The continental breakfast in the Club Room in the mornings consisted of fresh fruit, cereal, breads, coffee/tea and juice. It was all very nice, and the attendant was a sweetheart. I enjoyed reading the complimentary Enlish-language Puerto Rican newspaper while having my coffee. I don't gamble, so I can't really comment on the casino area here. Parking is plentiful and free. We took all our other meals in town, so we didn't try the on-site restaurant. Overall, I think this was a good choice for us on our trip to Ponce. This hotel is on the western edge of the city (quite easy to find), not downtown, but it is only a short drive to get there. If you don't have a car here, I am not sure what you would do. The hotel could probably stand some updating in terms the physical plant, but not so much that it would put me off staying here again. We really liked the friendly staff and the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Was well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: lachula4u2nv
Reviews.Content: We did not have a reservation because we had booked at another hotel which was complete garbage (Parador Guanica 1929) so we were at their mercy for a room and for a good price. They provided both and the front desk staff was very accomodating and the room was roomy and clean. The pool was nice and the hotel ambience was great! The hotel restaurant was not too pricey and the food was decent. I would suggest to venture out of the area in Ponce to truly see what it has to offer. We even asked where we could find a good monfongo and they referred us to a Dominican man in a truck.....for $13 bucks you get huge shrimp and the best Monfongo we had ever tasted!! Pharmacys and shopping was close by. This is a good place to stay and we would recommend it.....

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable good place to stay a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jimsreview
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Ponce was an average hotel. Clean comfortable rooms. Stayed one evening would shop around a bit next time for less expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: MUMU-7
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel. The front desk staff was friendly. The room was clean, but the shower was clogged. House keeping just work until 5pm, and I needed more sheets for my twins and couldn't get them. The pool area was clean, but there is no bar, just 2 Coca-Cola vending machines, no music. Very windy area. The food at the only restaurant was awful. The "mofongo" was very dry and crumbly. The meat that I ordered was tasteless. The kids macarroni and cheese was really penne(too big for little mouths), and cold. To expensive for the quality of food. At breakfast the eggs were not good (over cooked), the pancakes were burned. Woldn't stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: nloomis
Reviews.Content: While I agree that this hotel is nothing extrodinary I would disagree with the rest of the recent reviews. I stayed in this Holiday Inn last weekend and had a blast. The rooms were comfortable, the staff was friendly and polite and the views are breathtaking. The hotel is perched on top of a cliff and you overlook the ocean from the rooms and from the pool. The bar area also has a beatiful view of the ocean. I will definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your $, go to the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are Priority Club members and stay at Holiday Inns regularly. This was the worst Holiday Inn that we've stayed at on a vacation. The Holiday Inn Express in San Juan is a far better hotel in terms of service and amentities than this one, and it's far cheaper. There are no transportation services to/from airport or surrounding sites and no tours to sign up for even though there are plenty of sites to see in the area. My room was serviced only once during our 3 day visit. When I complained, towels were left on the bed. The dirty towels stayed on the floor in the bathroom, and the bed was not made. Even though we're members of Priority Club, we weren't told that breakfast was complementary until we overheard someone talking about it on our last day. However, you are given $10 in casino money for certain tables, and 2 drink tickets. If you want a great time in Ponce, go to the Hilton on the beach. They offer tours and transportation. If you're planning to see San Juan, the Holiday Inn Express in Condado is relatively inexpensive, has complementary continental breakfast, and offers tours to sites around the island including El Yunque, kayaking in the bay, and the beaches. BUT, has NO PARKING, otherwise check out the Comfort Inn across the street. They offer parking for $10/day and are relatively inexpensive. If you want a great time in the rainforest, stay at Casa Cubuy and take a rainforest hike with Robin Philips. This B&B is wonderful (not a 5 star resort, but a great family atmosphere, great scenery, and very private). It was the highlight of our 8 day trip!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Middle Island, Long Island, New York
Reviews.Title: “Spend the extra 50 bucks and go to the Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: sambuca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving unexpectedly in Ponce. The first night we checked in late, went straight to our room, walked out on to our balcony to discover it was located directly over the trash bins. The bathrooom was sooo outdated.I was totally exhausted so we decided to stay the night and deal with it in the morning.Throughout the night we endured loud banging. We didn't realize that deliveries were made throughout the night. We checked out the pool area in the morning and decided that we would stay if we could have a first floor pool view, AWAY from industrial noises. They were able to accomodate us,however, this room was even more outdated than the last!The bathroom had lighting fixtures that were such a dark shade of yellow from age that you couldn't even see your own shadow in the bathroom. The mirror was cracked and stained.... We made a quick u-turn back to the lobby and quickly decided to check out the Hilton down the road.Holiday Inn cost $160 Hilton $220.As soon as we pulled up we took a deep sigh of relief. Spend the extra couple of bucks,it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool”
Reviews.Author: julesvacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in June and was surprisingly pleased with the hotel. We were also given a room on the executive floor, yes the bathrooms are small but the room overall was spacious and not at all dated. The continental breakfast and evening cocktail hour in the private room on this floor was a nice perk. The staff was friendly and helpful. Loved the pool. Most likely stay here again when visiting the Ponce area.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Feb. '04 and we were pleased with the hotel in general. We had a room on the executive floor and got a very nice, quiet room away from the casino and also a very good continental breakfast. As far as the previous review goes, we did not think it was that bad of a room-and who goes on vacation to stay in the room, anyway? The nearest beach was not all that good-nicer ones in Fajardo or Condado-but the pool was nice. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical low-end Holiday Inn at 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: djcrooks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your typical old style Holiday Inn. The rooms are comfortable but nothing memorable. The bathrooms are small and seem kind of outdated. In the U.S. this type of hotel would be no more than $50-75 per night, but they are charging $125 for the cheapest room. Along the south coast of Puerto Rico there are precious few places to stay, therefore the rates are high. I had to go to 3 floors to find a soda machine that worked, but other than that, everything seemed to be in working condition. It's an ok hotel to stay 1 or 2 nights, but don't plan your whole vacation around this property or you will be disappointed.
